On August 24, 2018, the same day that the City Council closed the city's only sanctioned place for the homeless to sleep, the ACLU and NLCHP sent a letter to Durango's city council opposing the enforcement of Durango's camping ban against unhoused residents who have nowhere to go. In response, Durango placed a temporary moratorium on overnight enforcement of its camping ban. However, the city's actions continue to drive unhoused people into Durango's jails and courthouses by broadly defining camping to include anyone simply trying to sleep. The city's proposal to only allow sheltering "from the hours of sunset to sunrise" with the "written action of the City Manager or other designated official" punishes unhoused people with disabilities, for whom it is difficult to take down and put up a tent every day, and provides no "designated areas" where it is legal to sleep.

Tell the city to STOP passing new laws that make it a crime for an unhoused person to sleep and START providing housing for all.

We look forward to seeing you there,

ACLU of Colorado
